content: a cozy moebius cowl using a beautiful blend of woolstok light and prairie held together throughout offering directions for both the advanced beginner and intermediate knitter and with endless color options to select from this cowl will be a new favorite experience level * advanced beginner materials * prairie fingering 53% suri alpaca 47% baby huacaya alpaca 50g/273yds 2 hanks a * woolstok light fingering 100% fine highland wool 50g/218yds 3 hanks b * crochet hook for provisional co * tapestry needle * stitch marker * spare needle for kitchener optional finished measurements * width flat 11 * length flat before seaming 30 color shown * elderberry no 1110 a * northern lights no 2322 b notes * this cowl is worked with one strand of a and one strand of b held together throughout * this pattern is written to accommodate various skill levels version a grafted for a seamless finish as shown using kitchener stitch version b seamed for an easier-to-execute seamed finish
